item.title: 贸易协议达成后，中国又购买了四批美国大豆
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）与习近平举行贸易谈判后，中国又购买了至少四批美国大豆，将于今年晚些时候和2026年初装运。【原文：China purchased at least four more US soybean cargoes for shipment later this year and early 2026 following trade talks between President Donald Trump and his counterpart Xi Jinping, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 风险转移，发达货币与新兴货币齐头并进
item.description: 发达国家和新兴国家的货币越来越步调一致，颠覆了几十年来的传统观念，因为政治风险给富裕世界带来了沉重的压力。【原文：The currencies of developed and emerging nations are increasingly moving in lockstep, upending decades of conventional wisdom as political risk weighs on the rich world.】

item.title: 日本两年期债券拍卖需求低于 12 个月平均水平
item.description: 日本的两年期国债拍卖吸引了比 12 个月平均水平更强劲的需求，因为市场猜测日本央行不会匆忙进行下一次加息。【原文：Japan’s two-year government bond auction drew demand that was stronger than its 12-month average on speculation the Bank of Japan isn’t rushing into the next rate increase.】

item.title: 中国钢厂在一季度表现强劲后再次面临压力
item.description: 中国钢厂在利润率短暂回升后再次面临压力，因为原材料成本转高，有可能在第三季度盈利走强后侵蚀利润。【原文：China’s steel mills face renewed pressure after a short-lived recovery in margins, as raw materials costs turn higher and threaten to erode profits following a stronger third quarter for earnings.】

item.title: 黄金热潮促使交易商 MKS PAMP 扩展在香港的业务
item.description: 贵金属精炼商和贸易商 MKS PAMP SA 正在加强其在香港的业务，以吸引投资者对金银的浓厚兴趣，并利用香港推动在市场中发挥更大作用的契机。【原文：Precious-metals refiner and trader MKS PAMP SA is boosting its presence in Hong Kong to tap surging investor interest in bullion and take advantage of the city’s push to play a bigger role in the market.】

item.title: Lenskart Solutions 8.21 亿美元的首次公开募股在印度蓬勃发展的市场上引起投资者热议
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本央行之后日元创 8 个月新低，片山就外汇问题发出警告
item.description: 日本财务大臣片山聪树表示，日本政府正以强烈的紧迫感监控日元走势，这是她上任以来首次就货币走势发出明确警告。【原文：The Japanese government is monitoring the yen with a strong sense of urgency, Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama said, sending her first clear warning on currency movements since taking on her role.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋的出走让韩国炸鸡股升温
item.description: 黄健翔的病毒式美食推动了韩国炸鸡相关股票的大幅上涨。【原文：Jensen Huang’s viral meal is driving a sharp rally in Korea’s fried chicken-related stocks.】

item.title: 创始人将在印度 Groww IPO 中获得 19 亿美元的财富增值
item.description: 拉利特-凯什雷（Lalit Keshre）还记得，2002 年，他还是孟买的一名学生时，以不到一美元的价格买到第一支股票是多么不容易。【原文：Lalit Keshre remembers how hard it was to buy his first stock for less than a dollar as a student in Mumbai in 2002.】

item.title: 日产汽车发出 18 亿美元警告后，丰田、本田为利润下滑做好准备
item.description: 在日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.）发布全年运营亏损 2,750 亿日元（合 18 亿美元）的预警之后，丰田汽车公司和本田汽车公司（Honda Motor Co.）将接踵而至，为日本汽车制造商的财报季拉开序幕。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. and Honda Motor Co. are next up after Nissan Motor Co. kicked off the earnings season for Japanese carmakers by warning of an operating loss of ¥275 billion ($1.8 billion) for the year.】

item.title: 对冲基金押注日元年底将跌至 160 点
item.description: 在美联储和日本央行不断变化的利率政策推动下，对冲基金押注日元将在今年年底前走低至 1 美元兑 160 日元。【原文：Hedge funds are betting the yen will weaken to as low as 160 per dollar by the end of the year, driven by changing approaches to interest rates from the Federal Reserve and the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 中国工厂活动出现近十年来最长时间的下滑
item.description: 随着最后一个季度经济放缓趋势的加深，10 月份中国工厂活动下滑加剧，创下九年多来最长的下滑记录。【原文：China’s factory activity slump worsened in October, reaching its longest decline in more than nine years as a deepening economic slowdown sets in during the final quarter.】

item.title: 中国销售意外下滑后苹果公司预测恢复增长
item.description: 苹果公司将中国市场营收意外下滑归咎于供应中断，并预测随着 iPhone 17 势头强劲，苹果将在全球最大的智能手机市场恢复增长。【原文：Apple Inc. blamed a surprise decline in China revenue on supply disruptions, predicting it will return to growth in the world’s biggest smartphone arena as the iPhone 17 gains momentum.】

item.title: 中国股市将结束长达五个月的牛市，谨慎情绪卷土重来
item.description: 随着早些时候由流动性推动的反弹让位于对中美紧张局势挥之不去和经济陷入困境的担忧，中国股市将出现 4 月份以来的首次月度下跌。【原文：Chinese shares are on course for their first monthly loss since April, as an earlier liquidity-driven rally gives way to concerns about lingering US-China tensions and a struggling economy.】

item.title: 美国科技股盈利强劲，日元走软，日本股市上涨
item.description: 美国大型科技公司亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.）和苹果公司（Apple Inc.日元对美元汇率走低也起到了推动作用。【原文：Japanese stocks rose on buying fueled by robust earnings from major US tech companies Amazon.com Inc. and Apple Inc. and better-than-expected results from domestic names such as Hitachi Ltd. and Fujitsu Ltd. A weakening of the yen against the dollar also served as a tailwind.】

item.title: 野村前田称吉尔兹是欧洲最有吸引力的投资品种
item.description: 野村资产管理公司一直在抢购英国国债，因为与其他欧洲国家相比，英国国债的收益率看起来更具吸引力。【原文：Nomura Asset Management Co. has been snapping up UK government bonds as their yields look more attractive compared with other European countries.】

item.title: 气候变暖，中日携手开展台风研究
item.description: 中国和日本的科研机构计划在台风观测和研究方面开展合作，因为气温升高有可能使强大的风暴更具破坏性。【原文：Scientific institutions in China and Japan plan to collaborate on typhoon observations and research, as warming temperatures threaten to make the powerful storms more destructive.】

item.title: 首席执行官在调查中袖手旁观，坚定不移股价暴跌
item.description: 澳大利亚保险经纪公司 Steadfast Group Ltd. 的股票创下历史最大跌幅，此前该公司表示其首席执行官将在针对其工作场所投诉的调查期间暂时休假。【原文：Shares of Steadfast Group Ltd. dropped the most on record after the Australian insurance broker said its chief executive officer will take temporary leave amid an investigation of a workplace complaint made against him.】

item.title: 交易员评估中美停战力度，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 黄金巩固了前一天的涨势，维持在每盎司 4,000 美元上方，因为交易商权衡了中美贸易休战的影响，但这未能消除对世界两大经济体之间长期竞争的担忧。【原文：Gold consolidated gains from a day earlier, holding above $4,000 an ounce as traders weighed a US-China trade truce that failed to quash concerns about long-term competition between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 东京通胀加快支持日本央行加息，日元走高
item.description: 东京的通胀率上升较快，支持了日本央行继续逐步加息的理由，同时也提振了日元。【原文：Inflation in Tokyo rose at a faster pace, supporting the case for the Bank of Japan to keep raising interest rates gradually and giving the yen a boost.】

item.title: 印度航空坠机后向塔塔和新航寻求 11 亿美元救命钱
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，印度航空公司正在向其所有者塔塔集团（Tata Sons Pvt.）和新加坡航空公司（Singapore Airlines Ltd.）寻求至少 1000 亿卢比（11 亿美元）的资金支持。【原文：Unprofitable Air India Ltd. is seeking at least 100 billion rupees ($1.1 billion) in financial support from its owners Tata Sons Pvt. and Singapore Airlines Ltd., said people familiar with the matter, as the airline grapples with the aftermath of a deadly plane crash among other challenges.】

item.title: 日本央行态度谨慎，日本期待两年期债券拍卖
item.description: 周五，日本债券市场将出售对政策敏感的两年期债券，市场猜测日本央行不会匆忙进行下一次加息，因此日本债券市场的基础略显稳固。【原文：Japan’s bond market heads into a sale of policy-sensitive two-year notes Friday on a somewhat stronger footing on speculation the Bank of Japan isn’t rushing into the next rate increase.】

item.title: 人工智能狂潮助推科技霸主地位改写亚洲市场游戏规则
item.description: 对人工智能的狂热让亚洲股市今年的表现优于全球。同时，人工智能也在改变着该地区的市场，这让基金经理们竞相追赶。【原文：The frenzy over artificial intelligence has helped Asian stocks outperform the world this year. It’s also transforming the region’s markets in a way that has fund managers racing to keep up.】

item.title: 美国期货因科技股业绩下滑而上涨：市场综述
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc）和苹果公司（Apple Inc）的强劲业绩引发了盘后科技股的反弹，部分抵消了前一交易日的大量抛售。亚洲股票期货涨跌不一，而由于美联储缓和了降息预期，国债下跌，美元走强。【原文：Robust results for Amazon.com Inc and Apple Inc triggered a post-market tech rally, partly undoing heavy selling from the prior session. Asian equity futures were mixed, while Treasuries fell and the dollar strengthened as the Federal Reserve tempered rate-cut expectations.】

item.title: Meta 以破纪录的债券销售打破人工智能消费的阴霾
item.description: 尽管 Meta Platforms 公司股价暴跌，但该公司周四的债券销售仍受到了创纪录的追捧，这表明债券投资者对该公司的人工智能支出计划已不再有任何顾虑。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. found record-shattering demand for its bond sale on Thursday even as its shares plunged, in a sign that bond investors are looking past any concerns about its artificial-intelligence spending plans.】

item.title: 阿根廷央行放宽准备金规则以提高流动性
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政党在关键的中期选举中获胜后，阿根廷放宽了商业银行必须每日上报的存款准备金比例，以逐步提供更多的流动性并恢复贷款。【原文：Argentina loosened the share of reserve requirements that commercial banks must report daily in a bid to gradually provide more liquidity and revive lending after President Javier Milei’s party won a crucial midterm election.】

item.title: Fiserv 唯一的 "熊 "是一位 26 岁的分析师，他打败了华尔街
item.description: 在 Fiserv 公司股票大幅下挫之前，唯一一位对该公司给予卖出评级的分析师表示，几个月前就已经看出端倪。【原文：The lone analyst with a sell rating on Fiserv Inc. ahead of the company’s crushing stock selloff says the writing was on the wall for months.】

item.title: 各州数据显示美国上周初请失业金人数下降
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）对联邦政府停摆期间公布的未经调整的州一级申请数据进行分析后发现，上周美国失业救济金申请人数有所下降。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell last week, according to a Bloomberg News analysis of unadjusted state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: 美国安保承包商佩拉顿的贷款人组建新集团，因为停业有可能削弱现金储备
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由于人们越来越担心政府长期停摆可能会削弱佩拉顿公司的现金储备，佩拉顿公司的一组第一顺位贷款人已经找到了 Evercore Inc 和 Gibson Dunn & Crutcher。【原文：A group of first-lien lenders to Peraton Corp. have tapped Evercore Inc and Gibson Dunn & Crutcher amid growing concerns that a prolonged government shutdown could dent its cash reserves, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 越南特朗普品牌高尔夫度假村因土地纠纷受阻
item.description: 在河内郊外举行了华丽的奠基仪式五个月后，特朗普组织耗资 15 亿美元打造的豪华高尔夫度假村揭开了神秘面纱，但由于愤怒的农民对清场计划提出质疑，该度假村所在区域仍然只有香蕉和橘子树。【原文：Five months after a glitzy groundbreaking ceremony just outside of Hanoi, the area where The Trump Organization-branded $1.5 billion luxury golf resort was unveiled remains just fields of banana and orange trees as angry farmers challenge the site’s clearance plans.】
